Reviews.Title: “Just cross the street, and you'll see Palau Guell!!!”
Reviews.Author: Qototinho
Reviews.Content: I was in Onix Liceo in the December of 2009. Barcelona is my favorite city, and Onix Liceo is the best experience in Catalunya capital. If you want to be a minute-away-walk to the La Rambla, if you want to have modern design, helpful stuff and good breakfast in the morning, feel fearless to choose this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good choice for location to the whole of the city. Facilities minimalistic, but adequate. Breakfast good, staff very helpful, room clean. Ony things lacking was milk at the coffee/ tea bar in the lounge and wifi only available in public areas. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average and some points to be aware off before you book.....”
Reviews.Author: StephenMooney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights based on some of the previous reviews and the fact it’s advertised as 4 stars, close to Las Ramblas and reasonably priced. We looked at an awful lot of hotels before deciding. Overall, a very average hotel with some good points but also some bad points as well as some points that don’t work in its favour because the hotel don’t make some things clear. I’ll list them in the above manner and I’ll be honest and just let the information help inform any decisions you may be making, First the good: - The hotel was very close to Las Ramblas and very convenient to bars and shops - The hotel was clean, neat and tidy - The staff were not overly friendly but not rude – they did their job as well as can be expected. - The rooms are air conditioned – thankfully! - The decor of the hotel downstairs is very nice and well worth a picture or two - Two computers are downstairs free for guests use – useful for printing out boarding passes (just delete history afterwards) - Don’t be put off too much by any reviews that go on about the area the hotel is in, it’s just off Las Ramblas and like anywhere else in the world while travelling – be sensible, keep wallets & purses in your pockets and don’t use backpacks. We didn’t have any problems with the street the hotel was on – it was a lively area and we liked it. - Free water and coffee...(as long as you like it black) Now the bad: - Very noisy, like I say, it’s a very lively area and street with a few bars out the front of the hotel - Rooms are overlooked, so curtains drawn for some privacy and be prepared to be stared at if you’re lying in the back patio area - ‘Double’ beds are actually two single pushed together and not connected so you’re liable to fall down the middle - Very, very little hanging space – 4 to 5 hangers for the room; we have to leave most of our stuff in the bags and only hang out what we planned to wear the next day Finally, the ‘things that can’t be classed as bad but still disappoint you a little’.... - Yes, free wi-fi but that doesn’t extend past the first floor so if you’re on the second or third don’t expect to be able to take advantage of this - The free fruit advertised is nothing more than a few apples - No bar in the hotel but they do make that clear - We knew from previous photos that the ‘pool’ couldn’t really be classed as a pool and that it was nothing more than a paddling pool but we were still disappointed to see how small and narrow it was and that there was rubbish floating in it on a number of days that we were staying. - Yes, free water and coffee but you have to grab the water early in the morning as it does tend to run out and the coffee machine broke down at least once while we stayed Overall, very average and not a 4* hotel by any shape or stretch of the imagination. Not great but by no means bad and didn’t take away from the great holiday we had. If we were visiting Barcelona again we would probably go for a bigger brand 3* hotel to ensure a bigger room, bigger bed and something a bit quieter. My partner has also posted a separate review and has posted up the pics we took so I won’t bother reposting these. Thanks for reading and hoped this helped to give you a little more information to help you make a decision.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller240992
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona and wants to be in the heart of the city! Great location within Las Ramblas slightly towards the marina end which makes it a little quieter and within great walking distance to the scenic water front. Was slightly put off by reports of noise and no sleep so we requested a room on the higher floor when booking. On arrival we received a room on the top floor which was great! The room was clean and spacious with a floor to ceiling window. The temperature gage in the room was useful and we turned it up a little to make it warmer. The bathroom was fabulous with a fantastic powerful rainfall shower! Rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and towels changed too if you wanted. The free wifi located in the bottom of the hotel along with free water, coffee, tea and apples was a lovely touch and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel decoration overall was very grand and modern and felt more expensive than what we actually paid! Only thing to be aware of is local pickpockets in the side street of the hotel who tried to make conversation and then proceeded to try and steal my boyfriends phone. Luckily we knew his tricks and pushed him away. However this is typical of Barcelona and the hotel doors could only open by a member of reception or with the door key so I wouldn't say it put me off the hotel at all! Overall we had a fantastic stay and would definately stay here again!! Lovely hotel for the price :)

Reviews.Title: “very clean and comfortable but if you want a nights sleep,go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: twiggyrvs
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel in a great location but if you have a room at front,you wont get any sleep as the noise from the bar next door is disgraceful!people shouting and roaring till about 5 in the morning.room was very clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Akezka
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - 5 min from metro station, but if you want to sleep well at night - forget about it. There is a bar on the street and people make so much noise at night that you relax just closer to the morning. As for the rest, it is minimum which you get for a short and non-obtrusive stay abroad. Enjoy Spain, but not the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Costafeller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel because we found a good price on the internet, therefore, if I have booked at a normal rate I would be VERY VERY disapointed. First of all I don't get how can it be a 4 star hotel when its clearly a medium 3 star hotel. The room was small, really small, at least it was clean but the towels were old and worn out. I e-mailed the hotel a couple days before and I made a request on the booking act, which was never answered neither it was fullfield. There was no internet on the room (yes, it happened in 2012 not 1995), and there was only one channel in english (Disney channel...). The location was good, yes it was indeed, there are a lot of immigrants in the area but its a peacefull location, even at night. The heater made a lot of a noise, in ever 15-20m it would make a snap sound, even when it was off, and I could hear my neighbours opening and closings doors, talking and even taking a bath. The staff was ok, I mean, the female recepcionist was ok, but the the male recepcionist was arrogant and started laughing about something I said witch was very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for short city break. Prime location.”
Reviews.Author: a-little-escape
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and loved every minute of our stay. From the moment we checked in we were given a warm welcome from the staff at the desk. We had a beautiful room looking out onto the street. It did get a little noisy one night but I expected as much from a busy city. Breakfast was lovely, large selection of fruit, pastries, cheeses/hams etc. Would suggest getting more hot food however. Free water/coffee/tea in lounge area was a great bonus as well as the two computers with free internet access. The decor is very modern and sophisticated , especially the beautiful marble staircase- a big wow factor!! Also, our room was cleaned every day during our 4 day stay. New towels, bed linen, shampoo etc every day- the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. It is also very close to the metro station so you can go anywhere you like. Will definitely be returning to Onix Liceo, great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “A great good value 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ticktoneers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to going on a cruise. It was in a fantastic location just off La Rambla and very near to the ornate port building at the bottom of La Rambla where you can get a cheap bus to your cruise ship. It is a beautiful building which has been restored to its former glory. Some decor is modern contemporary and some traditional. Our room was a standard room and was spacious with a lovely bathroom and shower. The rooms have great air conditioning (cold and heat). There is free Internet use in the lounge and also free coffee, fruit and water. The weather was too cold for us to use it but there was a lovely clean lap pool outside on the terrace. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location easy to get everywhere by foot. The day shift staff were all great and helped me. The Hotel offers breakfast for 8 euros, that's good price. Room was nice, bathroom is very nice also. Large, comfortable bed, with a great private balcony off the room. The wireless internet only worked in the lobby and one one floor

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Prashant J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and found it average. The location is really good, just a 20m walk from the Ramblas. The rooms were nice and clean as well as spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful for the most part. However, I found a couple of things lacking. Firstly, the rooms did not have a safe. Considering that any decent 4 star that I've been to has one, and also the reputation of the Ramblas (even though personally I found it quite unfounded), the lack of a safe was a let down. Also, we got rooms which faced the street and there was a lot of noise late at night. Try getting rooms that are away from the street if you fancy a quiet night in. Also, the Wi-Fi although free was only available in the reception area. Trifles some might say, but that's the difference between an average and an extraordinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4*-Hotel very centric to everything in BCN”
Reviews.Author: Artegam
Reviews.Content: Onix Liceo is a very convenient hotel very close to the Ramblas and the Paseo Colon. The value for the dollar is great, staff is very helpful in making reservations and they offer free WIFI in the very relaxing and quiet Lounge as well as free water and coffee. Ideal place for a city-trip, good value and clean. - What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Beautiful Downstairs, Slightly disappointed with the room”
Reviews.Author: GunnerGirlYuffie
Reviews.Content: We (my partner and I) stayed for 5 days with lastminute.com in December 2011. The hotel was extremely easy to find, located just off Las Ramblas next to Drassnes metro station. It is an absolutely fantastic hotel location wise for the metro, for Las Ramblas, for the gothic quarter and for the harbour and we were extremley pleased. We were greeted by friendly staff every time we arrived or left and were helpfully offered storage for our luggage while we waited for the rooms to be serviced and for when we could check in. The downstairs of the hotel is stunning, the staircase sympathetically in keeping with the more modern aspectes of the hotel. The lounging area very pleasant and the H20 area, (a place for free tea, coffee, apples and water) a lovely touch. Though may I suggest leaving a small carton of milk in the fridge for those of your guests who enjoy tea with milk. Our room was very clean, comfortable bedding, beautiful bathroom and plenty of storage and hangers for clothing. However, there were some signs that the room was falling into a little disrepair with some rather large black marks on the wall and quite a big hole in the wall. It was a shame because this would otherwise be a lovely room. The room is also not soundproofed. And that really did irk me. The website clearly states that it is and really, that should be taken off as we could both hear the room next to us moving things around and being quite noisy, as well as the music that it is played around the hotel and the echoing of the large staircase. Luckily I brought my ear plugs. All in all though, a fantastic place to have stayed and I would recommend it as a three star, comfortable, clean, quirky and fantastically located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Serenidad58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2011, and we were very pleased with the hotel! The main thing we were concerned with was finding a hotel with a good location, and this hit the mark! It is half a block away from La Rambla, and centrally located on the strip. The staff was helpful and friendly, and the hotel itself was quite beautiful! There is a lounge area with TWO computers with free internet (this was leaps and bounds above our other hotel in Barcelona), and a refreshment station with cold bottled water, coffee, tea, etc. Then there is a fairly large outside courtyard with some more chairs and a pool. The pool looked nice but was undergoing some renovations while we were there so we couldn't use it! The rooms were also a pleasant surprise! They were very modern and clean. Lot's of space, and the bathrooms were large as well! There is an area downstairs where they serve breakfast, and you can eat there, but it is not free. I would recommend instead walking the few blocks to La Boqueria and getting breakfast there (the bocadillos are amazing)! All in all it was a great hotel! The location was wonderful, everything was new and modern,. and the price was lower than other hotels in the area, so you get a great value! I would recommend this hotel to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “5 stars”
Reviews.Author: tom m
Reviews.Content: great hotel! great location just 5 minutes from ramblas st.! we came to barcelona for football match and the girl at the reception arranged tickets in 10 minutes! amazing!

Reviews.Title: “good location, modern rooms but noisy”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowGal123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a weekend trip to see the city. The hotel was very centrally located just next to the main Ramblas. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and had good English (fortunately!) Free wifi in the main lobby and there were nice comfy seats to do this, so not having wifi in the room was not a big deal. They also had a couple of computers with internet access to use if required. Breakfast was good. Free water in the room and downstairs was a helpful touch. The rooms were clean and modern, and the bathrooms were also spacious and modern too. The only problem was the noise. The first night we had a room on the front of the hotel which was on quite a noisy street at night. The room was warm but it was too noisy with the window closed never mind opened! also as in previous reviews the walls were quite thin and we could hear the comings and goings of everyone about in the hallways and surrounding rooms. The next day we mentioned about the noise to the receptionist and he was very helpful and moved us to a room on the inside of the hotel with a room overlooking the main staircase. Overall, everything great except from the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: yzerdunn
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing the city but very noisy at night. The room was first class, clean and well maintained but the walls are paper thin and we had noisy neighbors. The street noise was loud as well. Didn't try the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: eg82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid-September based on the great Trip Advisor reviews and I now have to say I feel it's a fair bit over-priced for what you actually get. Saying that, it was adequate and we had no big problems or anything but as a few more recent reviews have stated, I can't help but feel it's over-hyped. It's certainly not the funky experience a lot of the reviews here seem to suggest, but more like a stay in a reasonable 3-star Travel Lodge or something. I'll list the positives and negatives as we honestly found them: Positives: - It was located just off Las Ramblas and therefore handy to everything. - I wouldn't be put off by the reviews about the dodgy street - we found it quite full of character and the London Bar next door is a great wee spot. Like anywhere in Barcelona, just don't flaunt your belongings or be careless and you should be fine. - For a central location the hotel was pretty quiet at night - we had a room at the back. - Any of the funkiness the hotel has is in the communal area - the black and white staircase is cool and the seated area at the back is fine. I guess it just depends how muchtime you think you'll be spending there - there's no bar in the hotel itself. - The hotel room was clean and did have a nice bathroom. - Free water (when the stocks haven't run out.) - The staff are neither unfriendly or overly-friendly, they do their job and in our experience no more, no less. Negatives: - We booked a double room but got that annoying thing where they've just pushed two singles together - dead on if you're secretly quite happy to put a bit of space between yourself and your partner, annoying if you fancy a bit of romance as you'll end up falling down the middle! - Fee Wifi doesn't reach the upper floors - we were on the 3rd floor and had no signal. - Very little hanging space in the wardrobe - 5 hangers. - The room is very over-looked - you'll pretty much have to keep the curtains closed the whole time while you change etc if you're remotely shy! Then again, book a hotel this central and what can be expected but a blind would have been nice. - The free fruit is a bit over-exaggerated - more like a couple of apples. - The swimming pool isn't really a pool, it's just there for looks. It's tiny and had rubbish floating on it a lot of the time - gave me the creeps! So to sum up, it just depends what you want. If I was booking again and just wanted an adequate room, I'd go with one of the big brand 3-stars that you can get a good bit cheaper. If you book Onix Liceo you'll get an average room with no particular frills, just don't go expecting anything more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Reets13
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, lovely staff. The most comfortable beds and the best shower! Really central. Cannot fault it. Only 1 negative comment. Fresh fruit was promised every morning, but the same bowl of very tired apples appeared every day. Rather leave them out completely. The coffee and water was good enough!

Reviews.Title: “SHAME ON YOU HOTEL ONIX LICEO!!”
Reviews.Author: PhylSam
Reviews.Content: I have to say, our stay at this hotel has been tainted by an experience that is still unresolved one month later. We arrived for a night stay with two rooms in late July. We were given rooms 201 and 202, side by side rooms prior to our cruise. What we did not know till we were on board the ship the next day was that one of daughters left her treasured stuffed animal "Bambi" in the room. The next morning, arriving into Monte Carlo, we contacted the hotel via emails to try to arrange for Bambi to be saved so that upon our return to Barcelona we could pick her up. She has had this Bambi since she was a baby is heartbroken that she left it behind. The hotel never returned our emails and we ended up at an airport hotel in Barcelona at the end of our cruise 13 days later. We called the Onix Liceo hotel with the help of our front desk person in Barcelona. The man at the Onix Liceo assured us that they had Bambi and would send her to us. It is now 1 month later and after 14 emails, we now have a demand from a Pilar Jimenez from the front desk of almost $100 to mail Bambi back. We have no idea who this person is, why we have to wire money to a "bank account" nor will they accept our charge card that we had booked our stay with. Needless to say, do not trust the front desk at this hotel. We do not know who is really running this hotel and their email is obviously not secure. I think that hotel who cares about customer service would have mailed this back for a child without a problem. Someone there is trying to scam us. Do not let them scam you.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: touristlocal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for our stay but is certainly not 4* (unfortunately for us, we paid 4 * price!). Air conditioning was not up to the job of 30 degree heat, we did say to staff at reception and it was seen to, but was only minimally better. Due to our circumstances, we knew we would spend more time at the hotel than we normally would on a holiday, hence why we were happy to pay extra, but i have been to Barcelona a few times before, staying in bottom end and high end hotels and I certainly do not mind paying what you get, but overall i was disappointed here. Swimming pool was not really a swimming pool, more like a paddling pool. Rooms were clean but nothing special, bathrooms clean enough. Staff friendly. Location good. Next time I will stick to the cheaper 2 and 3 * hotels as i feel they offered the same basic service in the same location at half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel right in the centre of Barceloonaaa”
Reviews.Author: iaialondon
Reviews.Content: My boifriend and I stayed at the Onix Liceo for a few days after finding a good offer. The decor throughout is very funky (modern in an old shell), our room was huge and there's free wireless (we had it in our room too but I doubt it gets up to the top floors). Breakfast was included (but check for it) and was ok...moreover there's a sort of living room available with computers, printers, free coffee, free bottled water (which came very handy) and fresh fruit (apples) that can be used at all times of the day...we used it to chill out and even to eat lunch once. There's also a small garden and swimming pool...but they were doing works anyway I think will be ready in summer (2011). I was quite worried about some of the reviews claiming the hotel was located in a dodgy street...seriously this is nonsense...the street is ok and only minutes from the Rambla...it probably gets dodgier and dodgier walking further but we never saw anything suspicious...obviously Barcelona has a certain reputation...need just to avoid to be a fool... Anyway I suggest this hotel but only with an offer...on the contrary too expensive (>300euros/night!!!), the only reason why I'm not giving this hotel a 5 is because the price tag comes too high unless you get an offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: ThomasFurnari
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Onix Liceo in Mid-May 2011. Some of the highlights: - Perfect location - Multi-lingual and very helpful staff - Well secured, on a rather well-lit street, with 24-hour staff - Free coffee and water all the time! - Good sized rooms. Not huge, but worth the money. - Clean This is a 3-star that I feel could be a 4-star when comparing it to other hotels around the area rated as 3's. The staff were great, the place was clean, and the location is perfect. Yes, they charge you for a safe (around €6 a day)...but most hotels in Spain do. The breakfast spread is good for the money, but recommend getting only one day as it's better to go see the town! Also, Their website is very user friendly if you are having a difficult time booking on a travel site. The only negative we found was that we had some trouble with the Internet while we were there (the wired connection), but the wireless service worked pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location"”
Reviews.Author: QCCoon
Reviews.Content: Hotel just a 3 minute walk off Las Ramblas, the go-to street destination in Barcelona; Reasonably priced, perfect location, friendly staff. Assisted in obtaining a van taxi for airport trip. Wonderful breakfast each morning. Free cold water bottles and cold apples for day trips. Very secure with glass entrance controlled by front desk. Free access to a computer. Would stay here again with no reservations. Felt safe walking all around Barcelona. We were cautioned about gypsy pick-pockets, but had no issues. Loved the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JosephL10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Onix Liceo for 6 days from April 29 to May 5. It is a very clean newly renovated building situated approximately a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas and all its activities. An excellent breakfast was offered with cold and hot food. The hotel staff was very knowledgeable and quite ready to offer suggestions. We highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A desirable hotel in a Spot-On location!”
Reviews.Author: Ali-SM-57
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Barcelona for 3 days on the way back from a Royal Caribbean cruise and were looking for a nice hotel in a good location. Having found and booked online swiftly through hotel's website long before our trip, I wasn't sure if I was making a good choice... But when we arrived in Barcelona, we realized that the hotel location is just 5 minutes walk from the port's main bus station (Colon). Also the location being on a road off Barcelona's famous Rambla is a big advantage; 10 minutes walk from Catalunya Square (where all the City Site Seeing tours begin and other major shopping centres such as El Corte Ingles located) and only minutes away from Liceo Metro station, especially if you had very long and tiring day walking around in the city. Also it was only 15 Minutes walk from the famous beaches of Barcelona and 20 minutes walk to Olympic Village, National Art Museum and Poble Espanya. These were our personal experiences of the loaction during our stay in Barcelona. The hotel itself was very clean and furnished in a modern style, which was very desireable. Free wi-Fi in the lobby area, 2 PCs with free internet and moreover free refreshments (Tea, coffee, bottled water and fruites) on comfortable sofas was very pleasant and relaxing after arriving to hotel after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Service not as advertise, will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Pirate071
Reviews.Content: Be careful, some might like but I did not. Good point, close to center, clean room Bad Parking, not inside the hotel, therefore long walk with luguage, and expensive parking. Internet in room does not work, not able to find a solution or change room. Air conditioning not working (or just turn on) for them it's not the season, so if you are hot they do not care it's your problem. Small room. Typical europeen mindset in customer supplier relationship, the supplier here is always right, if you are not happy it's your problem.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but 4*???”
Reviews.Author: LenaCyprus
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean and convenient location. Good extra the free coffee and free bottled water from the lounge

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AntonioAA15
Reviews.Content: - Comfortable beds - Good breakfast - Excelent located - very friendly staff - stylish and light design

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: philryeland
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the fairly run down street that the hotel is located on. The hotel is of a good standard, staff were friendly and helpful. Clothe storage space in the bedrooms is a little tight for anyone spending more than four days. Free coffee and water is on tap, though there is no milk. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Placa de Catalunya and the aerobus terminus. Great location from which to explore Barcelona, we walked everywhere the longest walk being to Guell Parc which was still an enjoyable stroll with plenty to see on the way. Bari Gotic with its' restaurants, bars and shops and interesting streets make it a great place to stroll in the evenings, and of course La Rambla with it's street entertainment is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skevi
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. Rooms and generally hotel was clean. Staff was friendly and helpfull. The hotel is near the famous La Rmbla, the Plaza and the barcelona port and also close to the metro station. In addition the hotel offered unlimited free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: julieclarke60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Someone commented that the breakfast was a bit monotonous. The breakfast was lovely. I had cereal and pastries one day, cooked breakfast another, and cold meats and cheese another. There was also a section for diebetics. I think some people see the choice and think they have to eat everything on offer every day! What makes this hotel stand out from the others for us was the H2O area which provides complimentary tea, coffee, bottled water and fresh fruit at any time of the day. It was lovely to come back after being out all day and sit and relax in the lounge area with a coffee or take it up to our room whilst getting ready to go out on for the evening. The hotel is a mixture of modern and traditional. Some people might find it too minimalistic with litle atmosphere, but I liked the mix. One improvement might be to house a bar in the H20/lounge area. It would have been nice to have a drink before or after going out for a meal, but there was a mini bar in our room. The location was just off Las Ramblas, less than 10 minutes walk to the port. and within easy walking distance to all the places of interest. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JuiceBoxLuce
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Barcelona a year previous on Avenue Diagonal, I opted to stop a bit closer to all the city centre action on my second visit. This hotel is in a fantastic position, just off the Ramblas, barely takes 3 minutes to get there! Also within good walking distance to Maremagnum shopping centre, Cataluyna Square and the famous Boqueria market. One thing I would mention is that with the hotel being on a side street off the Ramblas, watch your bag and luggage. You see a few 'characters' hanging around on occasion but as long as you've got your wits about you there will be nothing to worry about. The hotel itself was lovely, modern, clean and cool - a haven after a spending a day out in the sun! The staff were also lovely, spoke good English, very helpful and chatty. Also free internet access and bottled water was a plus. I'd recommend the hotel rooms with private terrace, they're sheltered from the sun and it was nice to relax outside rather than being cooped up in the hotel room. All in all, a great place!

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: leonardoMilan
Reviews.Content: hotel is well recommended. clean and coomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel on a very good location”
Reviews.Author: tripdreamer1975
Reviews.Content: The Onix Liceo is a great starting point for you to experience the beautiful Barcelona. Right next to the Ramblas (but far enough to be quiet, especially the back rooms), it offers a nice design, great beds and matresses, free wifi, free water and coffee. Breakfast was just fine for me. The reception staff speaks good english (rare I'd say for Spain). To conclude, a nice, deign hotel at the right price. What else would someone ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EA1071
Reviews.Content: It 's a clean and quiet hotel with friendly staff. It's so close to the Rambla and the Placa de Catalunya, so if you like sightseeing by walking all day, when you are tired you can easily have a rest at the hotel and get some coffee-tea or fruit for free. We stayed for 5 days at a room with terrace. The room and the terrace was a bit small and also had a bad isolation. Not a romantic one but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “You have to know what questions to ask.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPlatypus
Reviews.Content: The hotel said it had AC. Yes, BUT - see further along. Why is that important? We were there on Friday, 5 November and it was quite warm in Barcelona. We were shown to a room with a window opening onto the huge, historic stairwell. The room temp got up into the high 80's-low 90's. Isn't the AC working? The front desk clerk said the AC was turned off on 1 November, and opened the window (with a special key type tool) and said to call him to close it later because it would be very noisy. There were no other rooms available. So we could either not sleep due to the heat/ lack of air, or not sleep due to the noise. We chose the open window and managed to get a few hours of sleep. There are lots of hotels in Barcelona; I wouldn't stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: bertiebuttons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the 'Old Quarter' and is in the perfect location in Barcelona. Just a stones throw from The Ramblas and all the other attractions. The hotel has very trendy decor, combined with original features and provides free computer use. The reception staff speak English extremely well and were most helpful to us as we had a problem with our transfer transport to a cruise ship. The room we were allocated was modern, air conditioned with a good bathroom, very comfortable bed and excellent flat screen television. The room however looked out on to the central atruim and the window didn't open, which while fine for one night wouldn't have been acceptable for longer stays. Lighting was insufficient for reading.There was only 1 mirror which was in the bathroom (not full lenght). There is a lovely courtyard out the back. Breakfast (self service) was good. Security at the hotel was good as you had to use the electronic key to enter the building, important in a city where crime is rife.

Reviews.Title: “disappointement”
Reviews.Author: jfdx
Reviews.Content: the so-called ONIX room I booked was not available when I arrived, the car park slot I had reserved was taken by another guest, I was charged the same (high) rate for the non-ONIX and the ONIX room (I changed room during my stay). In short, a tourist hotel where they abuse people based on a very-well designed website.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,reasonable price clean but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Modernelady
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean . The rooms were definately on the smallish side and the closet had no door. Good location, near Las Ramblas, but on the noisy side at night. Take CARE LOTS OF PICKPOCKETS

Reviews.Title: “ideal place to stay to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: diane_f100
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay for four nights at this hotel. Very elegant , modern and clean, very friendly and helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very helpful and friendly staff, will go to same hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: niveknodnel
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent being a short walking distance to Las Ramblas and the port. Walking or the metro was the best form of transport as it was cheap and easy for access to all key sites. The hotel is very well finished with a very attractive mix of contemporary and traditional / historic features. The staff were very helpful and courteous and the breakfast was great value for money. We expected it a bit noisy being in the central location so be prepared for late nights out to avoid the noise outside. We will probably request a room at the back of the hotel and higher up next time, although when we were in the party spirt we slept well! Our room was very well presented and good value for money. Beware of pickpockets and bag thieves, we were lucky to apprehend a culprit on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty1224
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just off La Rambla so is close to all the tourist attractions. The hotel itself is superb. Our room was very clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated as is the whole hotel. The staff were fantastic they suggested places to go and eat each night off the main tourist track and every meal we had was superb. They also advised us which tourist attractions we should see as we only had 3 days. The buffet breakfast was great with a huge choice and diets catered for. All in all it was a great weekend and a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: kjakeman
Reviews.Content: After staying at another hotel earlier in my stay in Barcelona, I can say I was very disappointed with this hotel. The room was horrific, like a prison cell with high ceilings and a window which was blanked out. This 3* hotel was like an upmarket hostel, paying €324 is never going to happen, the communial areas were horrid, breakfast served on a sideboard was like being in a boarding school. Do not stay here unless you have absolutely no alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MM R
Reviews.Content: Super location but arrival reception was average and not welcoming. Being in the travel industry for 25years I know welcome when I see it. Also got locked out of the hotel while the reception went to the bathroom - others on the inside couldn't get out either. Never experienced that before. Room was small but did have a balcony. Noise from adjacent rooms was quite noticeable. However it was very central and clean and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, stylish, great sense of space”
Reviews.Author: Sittinaroundoinuthin
Reviews.Content: Good place, good location, stylish, great staff...except for just that one horrible grumpy woman on the front desk sometimes. Fenced-off private balcony in our room was cool, huge double bed was good, it's clean, looks new. No restaurant/bar, it's really just the rooms with a big area downstairs to use. Wifi didn't reach us on 5th floor which was a bit of a pain...but if you are coming to see Barcelona rather than sit in your hotel, this place is a clean, safe, central hotel. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hostel; but not a hotel by any means.”
Reviews.Author: Najmeh
Reviews.Content: We were misled by the stars this hotel was given on the internet. It is not a hotel; it is a comfortable hostel on a loud and not so nice sreet; and it is close to the tourist trap: Rambla!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel just steps from the Rambla and close to the harbour”
Reviews.Author: DDiduch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Cool patio. Free wifi. Free bottle water. Great location. Great staff. Balcony from room ovelooking the small side street.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed for a super stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: shifenated
Reviews.Content: Arrived back last night 22nd May from Barcelona. We had 4 nights there in The Onix Liceo hotel and all I can say was it was smashing. Having been to Barcelona before I knew approximately where the street was, but it was just right. A 3 minute walk to the Ramblas and right across the road from The Placau Real. What more could I ask for. We had a twin room which admittedly was a bit on the small side space was a bit tight at the end of the beds. Bedroom was so quiet you would swear you were in the middle of nowhere. Bathroom was lovely and spacious with a wonderful shower. As for breakfast, there was everything that you could think of. Loads of juices, cereals, fresh fruit. tea and coffee galore, croissants and lots of jams, yoghurts and even cake. scrambled eggs, spanish tortilla, bacon. Scrambled eggs were best I have tasted anywhere. All this for 508 euro for the 4 nights. Definitely the best value hotel in Barcelona. As for the staff, all of them were so helpful. Guests who comlain about staff, are usually rude to them initially and as such do not get the response they want. Have to add this is my 3rd trip to Barcelona and beware, it has lost the run of itself as regards prices. It has gone horrendously expensive for everything. Money just goes nowhere in Barcelona. As fo the price of some of the Hotels. How can they justify charging 300/400 euro a night when basically all you want is a nice bed and a clean functional bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel a lot but....”
Reviews.Author: judystone
Reviews.Content: there were a few issues. I disagree with the previous poster about the location. I thought it was great, just a short walk off the Ramblas and and easy walk to the Barri Gothic and the waterfront. I do agree that the street was a little seedy at night, but I never felt unsafe. It's on the same street as the Palau Guell, a Gaudi house that is being renovated and has cool chimneys visable from the street. The rooms were a bit small, but clean and modern. The closet was tiny, though, and it was a little difficult for two people to unpack in such a small space. The best part of the hotel was the back sitting room in the lobby and the outdoor patio. Free bottled water, fresh fruit, coffee and tea were available 24 hours a day, as well as 2 free internet terminals. Free water on a warm day is a big plus! There was also free WIfi, but only downstairs in the lobby or in the courtyard. It was very nice, sitting outside on the patio with my morning coffee (though it would have been nice to have some milk with it, steamed or cold...not much of a black coffee fan!) The only problem with the hotel was the lack of air conditioning. The room got fairly warm during our stay in late April, and as I understand it, they do not turn on the AC until May 1, which is apparently common in many European budget hotels. Luckily, our room was overlooking the courtyard, and the windows could be opened. It wasn't too noisy except for some dogs barking early in the morning. So if you stay here before May 1, you need to get a room in the back of the hotel!! I would stay here again, but maybe only when the ac was turned on! The price was certainly right in an expensive city like Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: tajetsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oni Liceo for 3 nights in April, 2010. Upon arrival, I pretty much gathered the hotel was NOT in a good area. The lobby was very inviting and the hotel staff were very polite, informed and overall really good. Our room was tastefully decorated, but quite small. We had a balcony which overlooked the street. You couldn't really say this was a balcony as it was only about a foot wide. IF you stay at this property get a room facing the garden instead of the street. The hotel was very clean and internet was easily accessable. They also offered coffee 24/7 and water downstairs. As far as the area, well, I guess if you want to be right on Las Ramblas then it's fine. I did not once feel safe stepping out at night as the street is very narrow and I think the crazies start coming out about 11 pm. It was extremely noisy and the hotel room was really warm, but we could not open our doors of the balcony as it was very very noisy. The crazies do not go to bed until about 6 am, so bring your ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: floopeygirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Room was quiet, clean, bright and comfortable. Free coffee, tea, water and fruit available 24/7 was very nice added bonus. Only downside - no English language TV station. Was there during airspace closures and if not for the free 24/7 Internet access, would not have been able to obtain much info. Would happily stay there again and again ...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: educky
Reviews.Content: Disaster struck in the form of the volcanic ash during our stay in Barcelona but the staff in the Onix Liceo were very helpful. We were stranded in the city but the hotel had no problem guaranteeing additional nights accommodation at standard prices (rather than inflating them). They were also helpful in contacting bus and train stations for us and in printing out maps and giving route advice so we could arrange alternative transports. On the downside the rooms within the hotel are not well insulated from the noise in the corridors but other than that we had no negative comments. The location is great with access to the gothic quarter only a 2 minute walk and the port only a little further. At night there is a slightly sleazy element to that end of La Ramblas but that can be easily overlooked. I would stay here again if ever back in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and good central location”
Reviews.Author: Delphinium00
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay very much. Nice clean modern hotel with a little bit of a difference with a lovely lounge area (with complimentary water, teas and coffee) and a great courtyard to relax in. Nicely appointed room, very good breakfast. Great location to explore from. Would stay there again! One little comment, the reception staff need to learn to smile more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JYL072
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Onix Liceo with my wife. Hotel is weel located and very nice. Staff was very friendly. Free water and fruits were a nice bonus and also breakfast was very good. One detail really annoyed during our stay: Our room was located on the side of Carrer Nou de la Rambla and the noice coming from street was really disturbing. 3 out of 4 nights I woke to hear someone shouting or groups singing on the streets. So request a room from other side of the hotel and your stay is most probably perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: skysurfer1
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable,clean, modern, wonderful breakfast, computer area and complimentary bottled water, coffee, tea and fruit. Excellent location close to Las Ramblas and walking distance to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: livetrip
Reviews.Content: I really loved my staying to the Onix Liceo. I had a terrace room with a very cute outside terrace. What I found very nice was the relaxation space on the ground floor, with the big interesting windows! When going again to Barcelona I would of course stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Onix Liceo”
Reviews.Author: johnny_green
Reviews.Content: Absolutely BEAUTIFUL. A very very very very NICE hotel. I have nothing bad to say about it. Every little detail about this hotel is nice, right down to all of quality fixtures and fittings. We managed to get a deal through the Hotel Onix Liceo website to have FREE breakfast included with our stay, I didn't know what to expect, but this was brilliant again, great food and a great selection of it. There was no expenses spared on the quality of the food neither. The dining room is also very nice. The free water and coffee is great! Free WIFI is great, the receptionists are extremely welcoming and give great help and advice. The location is perfect, 1 min off the centre of La Rambla (the main street in barcelona) I would definately stop again. Oh and we also got a balcony with our room although we never specified this in our booking and that was great. We booked the cheapest room (urban room) and this was brilliant so I cannot not imagine how nice the expensi've rooms would be, our bed was HUGE and very comfy! Thanks JOhn

Reviews.Title: “We really want to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paeonia76
Reviews.Content: We have two rooms, one terraceroom with nice terrace, remarkably quite for example on late evenings and one onixroom which was larger and well furnished. The cleaning was without any remarks. Very good curtains for blackout. The staff were helpful. We asked for help with restaurangbooking ( not easy in the afternoon before Barca-match) and the hotelreceptionist made a good job in finding one. The breakfast was enough varying and tasty. We liked to stroll along in the Barri Gotic quarters and the hotel is very close to this district.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible and Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: FluteFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for joining a conference and were very much looking forward to go there because of the nice internet site. However, it turned out to be a disaster. We were told to get a reduced rate by mentioning the reference of the conference at time of booking. And so we did, but when we arrived we were denied this reduced rate because according to the staff we did not make the booking the right way, although we did exactly what the conference organisation told us to do. Moreover, we got the most expensive room in the entire hotel. The staff was very unwilling to listen, they took money from the credit card without asking our permission, and we were forced to pay per night instead of paying at the end of our stay. I would definitely not recommend this hotel for conferences. I would also advise to make absolutely sure beforehand what will be the price, and collect all email communication with the hotel, since I heard many other people complaining about having to pay more than they agreed on beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “prime location, beautiful hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hugibr75
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is an amazing City! Be aware of pickpockets and read safety tips before you go. We had no problems at all when we visited. If your only there for a few days like us, take the tourist bus its well worth the money. Don't be afraid to go off the main streets and look for tapas, much cheaper and delicious. The hotel is amazing, beautifully decorated the rooms are a little small. The staff are very helpful will certainly go back there to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in very central location.”
Reviews.Author: marcus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews it had got from others and the great rate we got through Yeego.com - glad I did now. The rooms are spotless and everything appears to be brand new. One of the comfiest beds I've slept in also. Even though we were facing the street it was relatively quiet in the room and the blackout curtains were a blessing for a late sleeper like myself. From the moment we arrived, the staff were friendly and helpful - more than happy to spend time answering anything you asked. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that but you're only 2 minutes walk from the Ramblas and all it's cafes anyway. There have been many comments about the street it's situated on and I have to admit that it can seem a bit seedy late at night but I really don't think it's bad enough to be worth making an issue of. Like the rest of Barcelona and many other big tourist cities, just take the usual common sense precautions. If you are approached, don't engage them and keep walking with one hand on your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved four star rating”
Reviews.Author: greekbubble
Reviews.Content: We have just come back to the UK after a short break in Barcelona. Our stay at the Onix Liceo was great. The hotel isn't in the best street in Barcelona but once you are through the hotel doors it is as if you are transformed to a new place. It is clean, modern, has friendly and helpful staff and the buffet breakfast (which we paid extra for) was more than adequate. It is a few hundred yards away from the lively Las Ramblas and all your tourist needs are close by. If I visit Barcelona again I would not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricArthurBlair
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great localization, 200 meters from Las Ramblas, near metro and easy access by taxi, built in an old building but all modernized inside. Excellent breakfast, amazing staff (they help you giving hints of the city even if you don't ask them), good cleaning and really nice bed and pillows. The room could be bigger, but that's no matter at all. Free mineral water, coffee, tea and apples all day easily make you forget the room is not that spacious. Absolute silence at night. My only observation is that there's no chair or table to rest your luggage in the room and the wardrobe is small, what can be a problem for longer stays. The wi-fi internet was not available all over the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: john_tripping
Reviews.Content: A great location off the bottom of La Ramblas, you are close to all the action without being slap bang in the middle of it. The advisor at the front desk (who was a ringer for Dimitri from Paris) was beyond helpful and so slick at his job it inspired envy. Nothing was to much trouble. The access to free computers with internet and printer was a thoughtful touch. The free drinks in the attractive relaxation areas was another indication of a hotel that thinks about its guests. Breakfast included yogurts, cereals, meats, cheeses, fruit, pastries and some hot dishes. All were to a high standard. The room was well appointed with a comfortable bed, modern furnishings and decor. The power shower in the bathroom was great. My only gripe was the hand basin was shallow and too cool for school. This is my second stay. And If I ever go back to Barcelona, I will stay there.

HotelInfo.Name: Onix Liceo
HotelInfo.Address: Nou de la Rambla 36, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
